main event: A civilian in Brooklyn, New York reported seeing an object resembling a meteor cross the sky in about 2-3 seconds on November 14, 1964 at 10:57 PM EST.
interesting points: The object appeared to originate very close to the star Betelgeuse in the constellation of Orion.
The object was fairly bright, about 1st magnitude, and bluish-white in color.
The object was round and very small, about the size of a star.
The object moved very fast, reaching the horizon in 2-3 seconds.
The observer ruled out a meteor, balloon, and airplane as possible explanations for the object.
